alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 10 at 8:21AM PST until March 10 at 3:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following areas, Riverside County Mountains and San Bernardino County Mountains. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An atmospheric river producing rain at high elevations on a snowpack will lead to increasing melting and runoff. Flows in rivers and streams may increase quickly and reach critical levels. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
